alert.note: Alert for Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 4:23PM CDT until May 19 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Walker. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 422 PM CDT, Stream elevation sensors are indicating elevated water levels within the warned area. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Elevated flows are present in the West Fork San Jacinto. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Walker County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
